Nitro, Razor1911 has been around for 15+ years, and I've never, ever, not once seen a trojan ion one of their releases. Antivirus software these days do byte by byte checks, and some of the cracks that are used for releases will trip that and throw a false positive. Crackers are sick and fucking tired of people yelling trojan when in fact there isn't.

If you've downloaded a release from a well known group that has been around since the beginning, and your AVS flags the crack as a trojan, it's a false positive. Go ahead and analyze it. You'll never see it access internet.
